law.catch_line: Judgment may be obtained on motion.
law.text: A judgment may be obtained, on motion, by a surety against his principal or cosurety for money paid; by a client against his attorney for money collected or property received; by a party or officer against a surety for costs; and by a party against an officer for money collected or property received, and for the damages which such party is entitled to recover; and in all other cases specially authorized by statute; and the service of the notice shall be regarded as the commencement of the proceeding.
law.history: Transferred 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 1, effective July 1, 1953, from C.C. sec. 444.
